mapdb

Class Db

  • java.lang.Object
    • mapdb.Db

  • public class Db
extends java.lang.Object
    Db wraps over the mapdb database and essentially provides some basic hackjob lockout functionality so the database won't blow up.
    Author:
    feldh

    • Field Detail

      • db

        private static org.mapdb.DB db
        The mapdb database, decalred static because it is shared among all maps within this database.

      • data

        private java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap data
        The specific map used by this class.

      • lock

        private final java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock lock
        An instance of ReentrantLock created OUTSIDE of the class. The lock put into the constructor should be shared among all instances of this class.

      • dbName

        private final java.lang.String dbName
        The mapDb database name.

      • dataName

        private final java.lang.String dataName
        The mapDb map name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Db

        public Db(java.lang.String dbName,
          java.lang.String dataName,
          java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock lock)
        Constructs a database specifically giving control over one map.
        Parameters:
        dbName - The database name
        dataName - The map's name
        lock - The lock used and shared among all maps.

    • Method Detail

      • acquire

        private void acquire()
        Used internally. Initializes the database/map if it hasn't been done so the database is NOT CLOSED so use .transactionEnable() when initializing the database to ensure crash-security.

      • release

        private void release()
        Releases the lock for other threads

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Save the changes from memory to a file. This should be called periodically outside of the main thread. Calling it frequently will slow the program down.

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
        Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key. More formally, if this map contains a mapping from a key k to a value v such that (key==null ? k==null : key.equals(k)), then this method returns v; otherwise it returns null. (There can be at most one such mapping.) If this map permits null values, then a return value of null does not necessarily indicate that the map contains no mapping for the key; it's also possible that the map explicitly maps the key to null. The containsKey operation may be used to distinguish these two cases.
        Returns:
        the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - - if the key is of an inappropriate type for this map (optional)
        java.lang.NullPointerException - - if the specified key is null and this map does not permit null keys (optional)

      • put

        public java.lang.Object put(java.lang.Object key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
        Creates or updates the field associated with a given key.
        Parameters:
        The - key
        The - field to be created or updated
        Returns:
        The old value of the field or null

      • getOrDefault

        public java.lang.Object getOrDefault(java.lang.Object key,
                                     java.lang.Object defaultValue)
        Returns the value associated with the key or the default value if nothing is found. This should be followed up with a put.
        Parameters:
        The - key
        The - default value returned if there was no key
        Returns:
        Either the value associated with the key or the argument defaultValue

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(java.lang.Object key)
        Returns true if this map contains a mapping for the specified key. More formally, returns true if and only if this map contains a mapping for a key k such that (key==null ? k==null : key.equals(k)). (There can be at most one such mapping.)
        Parameters:
        The - key
        Returns:
        true if yes / false if no

      • remove

        public boolean remove(java.lang.Object key)
